author: S Senthalir
text:
A seven-year old boy, studying in a private school in Uppalam, died on Sunday morning hours after being bitten by a poisonous insect. Parents who alleged negligence by school administration threatened a protest which was later called off.

Seshadri Prashanth, who was studying in second standard in Amalorpavam School in Vanarpet, had complained of an insect bite to his teacher last Thursday. Immediately, he was taken to the school dispensary and provided medical aid and his parents were alerted. The boy’s parents took him to a nearby hospital. As he fell unconscious, he was admitted to the Indira Gandhi Government General Hospital. As his health further deteriorated. he was taken to the Jawaharlal Institute for Postgraduate Medical Education and Research. Without any improvement in his health, the boy passed away on Sunday morning.

Agitated over the alleged negligence of school authorities, the parents threatened to stage a demonstration in the school. However, the local MLA intervened and talks were held with the administration, following which, the protest was given up.
title: Boy dies of insect bite
